meanings.definition: Curious or unusual in a way that provokes dry amusement.
meanings.sent1: The droll clown made everyone chuckle at his silly antics.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the droll jokes in the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The droll penguin waddled around the zoo, entertaining visitors with its quirky movements.
meanings.sent4: His droll sense of humor was like a hidden gem, waiting to surprise those around him.
meanings.sent5: The droll painting of a talking cat hung in the art gallery, capturing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A person who is amusing in an odd or whimsical way.
meanings.sent1: The droll at the party had everyone laughing with his witty remarks.
meanings.sent2: She found the droll in the office to be a source of constant entertainment.
meanings.sent3: The droll in the play wore a hat made of cheese, adding a touch of whimsy to the performance.
meanings.sent4: He was the droll of the group, always coming up with unexpected jokes that left everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent5: The droll storyteller captivated the audience with his tales of talking animals and magical lands.
